definition: a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: The brother and sister quickly ran.
Hamasaki slides into them and shuffles quickly to the computer monitor.
sentences.chinese: 濱崎步套上鞋，快步走到電腦顯示器前。

sentences.english: The waiter turns on his heel and marches our order back to the kitchen.
sentences.chinese: 服務生原地向後轉，快步走向廚房。

sentences.english: We have to quicken our pace.
Double-time the troops to the mess hall.
sentences.chinese: 命令部隊快步向部隊食堂行進。

sentences.english: Jane marched out of the room without saying a word.
sentences.chinese: 簡一言未發，快步走出了房問。

sentences.english: Increase your pace gradually, so your body picks up momentum.
sentences.chinese: 逐漸加快步伐，使你的身體獲得動力。

sentences.english: Lambada, a fast modern dance originally from Brazil, also named dance next to skin.
sentences.chinese: 蘭巴達，源自巴西的快步現代舞，也叫貼身舞。

sentences.english: He hurried on, lest he should drop out in the forced match.
sentences.chinese: 他加快步伐，生怕在急行軍中掉隊。

sentences.english: We quickened our pave more and more as the time sped by.
sentences.chinese: 光陰荏苒，我們也在不斷地加快步伐。

sentences.english: Nina rushes in to take Teri to the safe house.
sentences.chinese: 尼娜快步走進，將泰瑞和金姆帶往安全屋。

sentences.english: As action accelerates, the responsibility on the health sector increases.
sentences.chinese: 隨着行動加快步伐，衛生部門的責任也在增加。

sentences.english: I last saw him beetling off down the road.
sentences.chinese: 我上次見到他，他正快步沿路而去。

sentences.english: She rushed out of the hut when she heard her dappled cow low in dismay.
sentences.chinese: 聽到小花牛驚慌的哞哞低鳴，她快步跑出茅屋。

sentences.english: She was near running, making me take quick tripping steps to keep pace.
sentences.chinese: 她幾乎是在跑，我得跌跌絆絆邁着快步才能跟上。

sentences.english: He quickly ran home, looking as if there was something wrong with him.
sentences.chinese: 他快步跑回家，看上去好象有什麼事不對勁。

definition: at a stride/taking large steps (while walking)
in big strides/(fig.) in giant steps
in a great rush/in a flurry
like a wisp of smoke/(to disappear etc) in an instant
